favourite.article: Thank you indeed for uploading this song which I heard at a conference for the first time around 1981. I had the refrain off head but have been looking for the complete lyrics since then until Sunday, April 24, 2016. The hymn ministered to me then and still does. All conditions bow to the name of Jesus. Php. 2:8-11. Glory to His name. The Lord with whom there is no unrighteousness shall not forget your labor of love.

He wants us to know Him moment by moment. To cast our cares upon Him and sense His tremendous love and sovereign care. This is what it means to abide in Him and enjoy Him in all His rich provision. Praise Him!
Praise God, We are Yours Oh Lord!!! No sickness that You cannot heal. We are saved and secured in Your everlasting arms. Thanks for uploading this song. God bless you all.

"Looking to Jesus till glory doth shine." I enjoyed this verse today and I picked my hymnal and found this song. (Heb. 12:2) Looking away to Jesus, the Author and Perfecter of our faith, who for the joy set before Him endured the cross, despising the shame, and has sat down on the right hand of the throne of God. Looked to Jesus.
God's truth is real in everyday life as is said in this song~~ even on this rainy day! ^~^
A good start with this hymn play today...
My grandma just died and this was her fav. song. :(

Act of God? God doesn't act that way; Satan does. It's God's fault? Think again. Next time someone complains mention these verses. As life unfolds we learn to trust in His infinite wisdom.
He is silently planning for thee in love, for it matters with Him about you.
I lost my beautiful daughter Kristina, aged 40, who leaves behind a struggling young family this past Thursday. This song is what the Lord has placed on my heart. Thank you for posting it.

Our Creator made us for the purpose of having close fellowship with Him. This beautiful song reminds us, that it is not just something that happens daily, but that He is pleased, and we are blessed most by a MOMENT BY MOMENT communion with our precious Lord Jesus.

This song comforts me a lot. He knows what I have been through. I am reassured and encouraged by His moment by moment love. We, Christians, belong to Him. Moment by Moment we are in His sight and under His care.
This is a "moment by moment matter."
